main event: On August 25, 1952, in Waco, Texas, there was a sighting of unidentified aerial objects, described as aluminum objects flying in formation at very high speeds, emitting no sound, and disappearing at a tremendous rate of speed.
interesting points: The sighting involved a group of aluminum objects flying in formation, traveling at speeds in excess of 1000 miles per hour, and making a sharp right turn at a tremendous rate of speed.
The objects were observed for approximately five seconds before disappearing, either into a cloud formation or by accelerating to a tremendous speed.
The witness, an assistant vice-president of the First National Bank of Waco, Texas, was trained in identification problems and had observed many unusual phenomena in the sky.
Physical evidence of the sighting was available or in existence, but there were no photographs of the objects obtained.
The report was confirmed and approved by USAF personnel, including Captain Roswell C. Madison and Major Donald E. Getty.
sighted object: group of aluminum objects flying in formation
witnesses: assistant vice-president of the First National Bank of Waco, Texas
